This is very interesting, but as Stack noted, our 64bit kernels
(SUSE-based) aren't currently allowing this.

Do you know the pedigree of your kernel? Is it derived from any major
distributions?

Can you also provide the results of "cat /proc/version" and
"cat /proc/cmdline"?

Are you using any other related JVM options? Exactly what JVM
version are you using?

Can you go over 3000m -- say 3200m?

Thanks for any further details,

- Gordon @ IA

joehung302 wrote:
> This might be a little off-topic but since Heritrix relies on a big 
> heap (well, at least in my settings) so I thought it might be good 
> to share my experience.
>

> with -Xmx3000m. I've seen in this forum talking about the maximum 
> heap being 2GB on 32-bit JVM. I'm not sure if you guys are using an
